00009 #ifndef __EDWEVENTBASE_H__
00010 #define __EDWEVENTBASE_H__
00011 
00012 #include "TObject.h"
00013 
00014 //this is a fantastically horrible place to put these... 
00015 //maybe I should put them in a namespace
00016 //EdwEvent namespace...?
00017 const Int_t kBoloTriggerType = 0x1;
00018 const Int_t kMuonVetoTriggerType = 0x2;
00019 const Int_t kNCTriggerType = 0x4;  //whenever (if?) we add the Neutron Counter data
00020 const Int_t kHLADataType = 0x2;
00021 
00022 class EdwEventBase : public TObject {
00023         
00024 public:
00025         //Constructors and destructor. Only Derived class and the Factory
00026         //SHOULD access these methods. 
00027         //However, in order for ROOT's I/O and rootcint to work properly
00028         //the constructor and destructor
00029         //have to be public. l4m3. Otherwise, I would have made them protected or private
00030         EdwEventBase(void);
00031         EdwEventBase(const EdwEventBase &anEvent);
00032         virtual ~EdwEventBase(void);
00033         virtual EdwEventBase& operator=(const EdwEventBase &anEvent);
00034         Bool_t IsSame(const EdwEventBase &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint = false) const;
00035         Bool_t operator==(const EdwEventBase &anEvent) const;
00036         Bool_t operator!=(const EdwEventBase &anEvent) const { return !(*this==anEvent); }      
00037         virtual void Clear(Option_t *option = "C");
00038         virtual void Compact(void) {/*nothing to compact */};
00039         
00040         //Calculated Quantities
00041         //Double_t GetTimeStamp(void);
00042         
00043         //Getters
00044         Int_t GetRunNumber(void) const {return fRunNumber;}
00045         Double_t GetEventTriggerTime(void) const {return fEventTriggerTime;}
00046         Long64_t GetStamp(void) const {return fStamp;}
00047         Double_t GetRunStartTime(void) const {return fRunStartTime;}
00048         Double_t GetRunEndTime(void) const {return fRunEndTime;}
00049         //Double_t GetTimeSinceLastEvent(void) {return fTimeSinceLastEvent;}
00050         Int_t GetTriggerType(void) const {return fTriggerType;}
00051         Int_t GetDataType(void) const {return fDataType;}
00052         
00053         Int_t GetDetectorStatusWord(void) const {return fDetectorStatusWord;}
00054         Int_t GetBlindnessWord(void) const {return fBlindnessWord;}
00055         UInt_t GetGSEventNumber(void) const {return fGSEventNumber;}
00056         Bool_t IsBlind(void) const {return false;}
00057         Double_t GetSecPerStamp(void){return 1.e-5;}
00058         
00059         Double_t GetStampTime(void){ return GetStamp()*GetSecPerStamp();}  //In Seconds
00060         
00061         //Setters
00062         void SetRunNumber(Int_t aNum) {fRunNumber = aNum;}
00063         void SetEventTriggerTime(Double_t aNum) {fEventTriggerTime = aNum;}
00064         void SetStamp(Long64_t aStamp) {fStamp = aStamp;}
00065         void SetRunStartTime(Double_t aNum) {fRunStartTime = aNum;}
00066         void SetRunEndTime(Double_t aNum) {fRunEndTime = aNum;}
00067         //void SetTimeSinceLastEvent(Double_t aNum) {fTimeSinceLastEvent = aNum;}
00068         void SetDataType(Int_t aNum) {fDataType = aNum;}
00069         
00070         void SetDetectorStatusWord(Int_t aNum) {fDetectorStatusWord = aNum;}
00071         void SetBlindnessWord(Int_t aNum) {fBlindnessWord = aNum;}
00072         void SetGSEventNumber(UInt_t aNum) {fGSEventNumber = aNum;}
00073         
00074         void myPrintB() const;
00075          
00076 protected:
00077         void AddTriggerType(Int_t aNum) {fTriggerType |= aNum;}
00078         
00079 private:
00080         void SetTriggerType(Int_t aNum) {fTriggerType = aNum;}
00081         
00082         Int_t fRunNumber; //big Run number. the small run number is found in the Bolometer data record
00083         Double_t fRunStartTime;  //begining of the Big Run 
00084         Double_t fRunEndTime; //end of the Big Run
00085         
00086         //these will change for every new event in the run. 
00087         Double_t fEventTriggerTime;  //will hold the earliest time and will need to be calculate
00088         //somehow. But without a common clock that gives an absolute time reconstruction
00089         //at this point in the Edelweiss experiment, this is impossible to calculate. 
00090         //the stamp value resets and the only absolute start time
00091         //in the DAQ is the individual computer PC times, which can not assumed to be
00092         //accurate beyond a second. 
00093         Long64_t fStamp;
00094         
00095         //Double_t fTimeSinceLastEvent;
00096         Int_t fTriggerType; //0x1 for Bolo event, 0x2 for Muon System, 0x4 if NC counter, 0x8 for next system, etc... 
00097         Int_t fDataType; //0x1 for raw Edw data, 0x2 for HLA Event, 0x4 for MC "raw", 0x8 for MC HLA type ?? is this a good or bad thing? what if somebody sets it to 0x5!
00098           //this might be extremely useful for opening up an Edw ROOT file and determining its event type..
00099         Int_t fDetectorStatusWord;
00100         Int_t fBlindnessWord;
00101         Int_t fGSEventNumber; //Global Software Event Number. starts from 1 with each new Run
00102         
00103         //start and top times of runs are not common to all records since
00104         //records can come from different systems. 
00105         
00106         //private methods
00107         void InitializeMembers(void);
00108         void CopyLocalMembers(const EdwEventBase &anEvent);
00109         
00110         
00111         ClassDef(EdwEventBase, 1);
00112 };

00114 #endif // __EDWEVENTBASE_H__
